Art. 4.258 
Emergence of new heirs 
The emergence, subsequent to the agreement, of new presumptive heirs in the direct line of descent who would be called to the succession in their own right does not affect the validity of the agreement, but the agreement remains without effect with regard to them.
With regard to the heirs referred to [1 in paragraph]1 1, the gifts referred to in the agreement are, for the purposes of reduction and report, presumed to have been made jointly to all the presumptive heirs in the direct descending line who are parties to the agreement.
